normalised: Okay guys, so someone asked about the best address format for courier guys in India, right? It's a legit question. See, a lot of times the delivery just gets delayed because the address is a mess. My experience? Clear and simple is king.

unnormalised: First off, ALWAYS include the full name of the receiver. Like, not just "Sharma," but "Ramesh Sharma" or "Priya Kumar." Next, the house number AND the street name. "H.No. 123, Gandhi Road" is way better than just "near Gandhi Road." Also, if it's an apartment, mention the flat number AND building name, like "Flat 4A, Shanti Apartments, behind CCD." Pin codes are KEY! Please mention the pin code without fail like "400001" for Mumbai.

unnormalised: Then there's the landmark bit. This is super useful if the address isn't perfectly straightforward. A nearby temple, a popular shop - anything helps. "Opposite D Mart," or "Near SBI Bank" can work wonders. The full city name is also important. Courier guys get confused between "New Delhi" and "Delhi".

unnormalised: And finally, guys PLEASE add a contact number! Even if everything else is spot-on, a quick call can save a whole lot of trouble. I always include my no, like "98XXXXXXXX" and my alternate number too just in case. Try prepone delivery time if possible. Trust me, a little extra effort goes a long way in getting your parcel on time!
